title: Senior Product Manager - Treasury Ledger
content:
Your mission
Wise has already pioneered new ways for people to transfer money across borders and currencies. Our customers can also manage their hard-earned money with the world’s first platform to offer true multi-currency banking.

Here’s how you’ll be contributing to the Treasury team

You will be accountable for the Treasury ledger which is the basis for all FX and liquidity management data
You will develop reasonable processes, controls and products that enable us to

Onboard product changes to the ledger safely and quickly
Continually monitor ledger health and accuracy
Provide real time metrics and positions to Treasury teams



You will work with the ledger team to define the long term vision for Treasury ledger 
You’ll work with engineers and analysts to quantify the health of the ledger in terms of accuracy, availability and real timeliness
You’ll identify the most impactful opportunities for us to improve ledger product, controls and processes
You’ll get to know our product flow of funds well and how they impact liquidity and FX
Where possible you will automate controls and processes so that we can continue scaling


This role will give you the opportunity to

Impact all of Wises customers - everything you do will impact millions of people across the globe
Choose your path to impact - we believe people are most empowered when they can act autonomously. So rather than telling you what to do, you’ll work with your team to create a vision of your own. Of course, you can always gather feedback from smart, curious people across  Wise but you’ll have the freedom to make your own calls
You’ll have the opportunity to travel and work with our teams in Tallinn, Austin and Singapore as well as meet various partners and organisations when needed
Grow as a product person and a leader – Grow and inspire your team and others to join our mission


A bit about you

You are a seasoned Product person with experience of inspiring others and with the ability in building products where there’s high degree of ambiguity on what to build in order to drive growth or mitigate risk
You’re hands on, and you’d do everything needed to make the team and the product successful. You get it done by thinking strategically and executing tactically
You understand financial engineering and can clearly articulate and optimise trade offs between financial risks
You are hands-on with data and enjoy coaching analysts and supporting developers in prioritising technical debt and bugs versus building new features
You have empathy for your customers and can quickly identify the problems worth solving, explaining your rationale with data (rather than assumptions)
You have a record of managing data platforms or back end services
You’re not afraid of learning skills you don’t know yet to unblock yourself and your team. You don’t stick to a “by the book” product lead role definition.


Beneficial, but not mandatory experience

Finance, Payments or Treasury experience particularly in Liquidity and FX or familiarity with accounting terminology and frameworks
Experience of building controls on financial data and working with real time data needs
Experience with using SQL


Our Offer

Base salary:  £83.000 - £110.000 gross / year base (based on experience & interview outcomes)
Restricted Stock Units (RSUs): https://www.wise.jobs/what-we-do/our-offer/ 
Numerous amount of other benefits:  https://www.wise.jobs/2020/07/07/benefits-in-our-london-office/ 
Salary (annual)£83,000—£110,000 GBPWe're people without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive. We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Every Wiser should feel that they can be themselves at work. Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards mission zero and able to progress in their careers.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences and makes sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to mission-zero.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.
Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

demographic_questions.header: Wise Diversity and Inclusion - Voluntary Demographic Questions
demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.
